description: This trap is generated when a wireless port moves
into enabled, disabled or online.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The current state of the wireless part of this port.
enabled : Port is actively looking for wireless
interfaces.
disabled : Port is administratively unable to detect
new interfaces.
reset : Interfaces have been detected and are
being brought up (access point is booting).
addressing : IP Address is being assigned.
register : Interfaces are registering for service
syncing : Interfaces are retrieving their
configuration and updating their state.
online : Interfaces are operational.
If an error occurs the wireless port will
transistion to the error state.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessPortState

description: This trap is sent by the platform if a wireless
port fails to boot too many times.
This is the MIB-II ifIndex of the port this entry
describes.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessPortIfIndex

description: This trap is generated when a client is aged out
of the table.

event.Summary: Client aged out of the table $v2

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Unique MAC Address of the station for which this address
table entry pertains.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessClientID

description: This trap is generated when a client has associated
to an interface that is web based network login
enabled.

event.Summary: Client has associated to web based network login

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Unique MAC Address of the station for which this address
table entry pertains.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessClientID

description: This is generated when a new AP is added to the
scan results table. It will ony be generated if
the value of extremeWirelessScanSendAPAddedTrap
is true.

event.Summary: New AP is added to the scan results table

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessAPAdded IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsStationId s EXAMPL EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsFirstSeen t 31536000 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsLastChange t 31536000 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPacketRate i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsChannel i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsAvgRSS i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsSSID s EXAMPLE EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRSNEnabled i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPrivacy i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsNetworkType i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAIEMcastCipher b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipherCount u 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipher b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtCount u 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtSuite b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRateSet s EXAMPLE EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsExtRateSet s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This is the MAC address of the detected station.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsStationId

description: This gives the sysUpTime when this station entry was created.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsFirstSeen

description: This gives the sysUpTime of the station entry the last time it was
updated (i.e. a beacon etc was received).
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsLastChange

description: This gives the rate at which the last packet was sent by the
station.
TODO: What are the units here on rate?
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPacketRate

description: This gives the channel the last packet received by this station
was recieved on.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsChannel

description: This is a running average of RSS values of all the packets
received from this station.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsAvgRSS

description: This provides the value of the SSID value as is was recieved in
the beacon or probe response. If no SSID was sent in the probe
this value is NULL.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsSSID

description: Indicates if RSN capabilities are enabled on the sending station.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRSNEnabled

description: This is true if MAC-based privacy is invoked on the sending
station.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPrivacy

description: This indicates what type of network it is. If this value is IBSS
the last beacon/probe response was sent by a host operating in
ad-hoc mode.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsNetworkType

description: This value gives the single multicast cipher supported by this
AP.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAIEMcastCipher

description: This value gives the total number of unicast ciphers supported
by this AP. It corresponds to the number of bits set in the
extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipher variable.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipherCount

description: This gives the list of cipher suites which are supported by
this AP.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipher

description: This gives the number of key-management schemes supported by
this AP. It corresponds to the number of bits set in the
extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtSuite variable.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtCount

description: This indicates the supported key-management suites supported
by this AP.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtSuite

description: This provides the value of the rate set IE as it was received in
the beacon or probe response. If no rate set was recieved then
this value is NULL.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRateSet

description: This provides the value of the extended rate set IE as it was
received in the beacon or probe response. If no rate set was
recieved then this value is NULL.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsExtRateSet

description: This is generated when an AP is removed from the
scan results table. It will ony be generated if
the value of extremeWirelessScanSendAPRemovedTrap
is true.

event.Summary: AP is removed from the scan results table

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This is the MAC address of the detected station.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsStationId

description: This is generated when the IEs recorded for an AP
in the scan results table change. It will only be
generated if the value of SendAPUpdatedTrap is true.

event.Summary: IEs recorded were changed to $v16 in the scan results table for an AP

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessAPUpdated IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsStationId s EXAMPL EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsFirstSeen t 31536000 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsLastChange t 31536000 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPacketRate i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsChannel i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsAvgRSS i 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsSSID s EXAMPLE EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRSNEnabled i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsPrivacy i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsNetworkType i 1 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAIEMcastCipher b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipherCount u 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAUcastCipher b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtCount u 9999 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanWPAKeyMgmtSuite b 0 EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsRateSet s EXAMPLE EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessScanResultsExtRateSet s EXAMPLE

description: This is generated when a new station is added to the
probe info table. It will only be generated if the
value of extremeWirelessProbeInfoSendAddedTrap is true.

event.Summary: Added new station to the probe info table

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This is the MAC address of the source which sent us the
PROBE REQ packets described by this entry.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessProbeInfoSource

description: This is generated when a station is removed from the
probe info table. It will only be generated if the
value of extremeWirelessProbeInfoSendRemovedTrap is
true.

event.Summary: Removed station from the probe info table

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This is the MAC address of the source which sent us the
PROBE REQ packets described by this entry.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessProbeInfoSource

description: This is generated when an off-channel scan starts
running.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This value controls the channels which will be scanned during
the off-channel scan. Two special values should be noted:
all - causes the radio to scan all channels supported by
the configured country code. While on each channel
the radio will send out probe requests if the value
of extremeWirelessScanSendProbeRequest is true.
every - causes the radio to scan all channels, even those
which are restricted by the country code. The
radio will only send probe request on channels that
are legal for that country code.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessOffChannelScanList

description: This is generated when an off-channel scan finishes
running.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This value controls the channels which will be scanned during
the off-channel scan. Two special values should be noted:
all - causes the radio to scan all channels supported by
the configured country code. While on each channel
the radio will send out probe requests if the value
of extremeWirelessScanSendProbeRequest is true.
every - causes the radio to scan all channels, even those
which are restricted by the country code. The
radio will only send probe request on channels that
are legal for that country code.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessOffChannelScanList

description: This trap is generated when counter measures are started
on a wireless interface.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This value is used in the counter measure traps to indicate the
reason that counter measures have been invoked.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessCounterMeasureSource

description: This trap is generated when counter measures are stopped
on a wireless interface.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap is generated when a wireless interface tries to
autoselect a channel. It indicates whether a particular channel scan was
successful, or if it failed then the reason for the failure.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This is the RF channel which will be used by
this transmitter. Range should be established
by configuration of RegDomain and PHYType.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessPhysInterfacePHYChannel

description: This OID reflects the status of the channel auto selection process.
variables.name: EXTREME-WIRELESS-MIB::extremeWirelessPhysInterfaceChannelAutoSelectStatus
